TopicTitle: Small drill and small ISRU converter?

Articles.Content:
Dear KSP players,

Does any of you know if there is a mod where i could find a smaller drill and smaller ISRU converter than the stock ones?

I'm looking that to fix them on a rover, to produce monoprop. The stock ones are way too big :-/

Thanks for your help

I'm not aware of such a mod, but it has been mentioned that a 1.25m ISRU converter will be added to stock soon:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/136915-Squadcast-Summary-2015-10-16-Two-Types-of-DC-and-Two-Types-of-ISRU

Cheers

Until that happens /\ you could try Tweakscale to make the current one and drill 1.25m

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/112693

pathfinder uses a smaller drill and an inflatable converter

karbonite has a tiny drill and small engines that run straight off what the drill digs up

Kethane is still a thing and has always had small drills and converters
Also, both MKS-Lite and UKS have smaller sifters and converters (including shovel).

Also, both MKS-Lite and UKS have smaller sifters and converters (including shovel).

Are you working on a smaller drill for Stock too?
Thanks for these first suggestions, i will take a look at them

Are you working on a smaller drill for Stock too?

If he was he couldn't say NDA's and stuff like that

I'm not aware of such a mod, but it has been mentioned that a 1.25m ISRU converter will be added to stock soon:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/136915-Squadcast-Summary-2015-10-16-Two-Types-of-DC-and-Two-Types-of-ISRU

Cheers

From that thread (bolded emphasis mine):

The mini ISRU is not as efficient cooling, cannot make monoprop, and is significantly less efficient (both in terms of ore use, making it a very poor choice for those 'ore powered ships' out there, and in terms of raw speed.
